title: The Farmer Wants a Wife is returning more than three years after it went off the air
text:
After a flurry of speculation, it's been confirmed The Farmer Wants a Wife is indeed coming back for a new season after a call out circulated on Friday.

But the popular reality show won't be returning to Channel Nine, which was home to the series for nine seasons from 2007 until 2016.

Instead, it's set to move to Channel Seven, with a call out poster looking for participants bearing the network's logo.

Back for more: After a flurry of speculation, it's been confirmed The Farmer Wants a Wife is indeed coming back for a new season after a call out circulated on Friday

The call out begins: 'FARMERS LOOKING FOR LOVE'.

'Australia's most SUCCESSFUL love show is BACK,' it continues, with contact details included at the bottom.

'The Farmer Wants a Wife is searching for single farmers who are ready to fall in LOVE.'

Making a move: The popular reality show won't be returning to Channel Nine, which housed the series for nine seasons from 2007 until 2016, with a move to Channel Seven instead

On the hunt: The call out reads, 'FARMERS LOOKING FOR LOVE. Australia's most SUCCESSFUL love show is BACK'

Speculation the show would be making a comeback began on Wednesday, after eagle-eyed fans of the series noticed a change on its social media pages.

A new cover picture was uploaded to the Facebook page and was later posted on as their profile picture on the official Instagram account.

Fans of the once popular show couldn't contain their excitement and pleaded for the reality series to make a comeback.

Detective work: Speculation the show would be making a comeback began on Wednesday, after eagle-eyed fans of the series noticed a change on its social media pages

The beloved reality series aired in 2007, in the hopes of helping isolated Australian farmers find love.

It ran for eight seasons before it was canned, but was picked up again in 2016 before dismal ratings saw it axed once again.

Daily Mail Australia reached out to Channel Seven, but they declined to comment at this time.
description: After a flurry of speculation, it's been confirmed The Farmer Wants a Wife is indeed coming back for a new season after a call out circulated on Friday from Channel Seven.
authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
